title: Harira Soup
ingredients: 6 cups vegetable broth, chicken broth or water
28 oz canned crushed or whole peeled tomatoes
1 cinnamon stick or ¼ tsp ground cinnamon
½ cup brown or green lentils, dry
½ cup fresh cilantro, chopped and divided
½ cup fresh parsley, chopped and divided
4 oz capellini or spaghetti pasta, broken into approximately 2-inch pieces
Lemon wedges, yogurt and dates, for serving (optional)
steps: In a large pot over medium heat, sauté onion in olive oil until soft. Add celery, garlic, ginger, black pepper, turmeric, cumin, paprika and cayenne pepper for 1 minute. Sautéing the spices allows them to bloom and deepen in flavor.
Add broth, tomatoes, cinnamon, saffron, salt, lentils, half of the cilantro and half of the parsley. Bring to a simmer, cover with a vented lid and cook for 30 minutes, stirring often.
Add chickpeas and pasta and cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until pasta is cooked. Add honey and remaining cilantro and parsley. Serve with desired toppings.
